revised_title: On the Production of Transient Electric Currents in Iron and Steel Conductors by Twisting and Magnetizing
tldr: The author investigates the production of transient electric currents in iron and steel conductors by twisting and magnetizing them. The study reveals that the existence of these transient currents is due to the production of a state of circular magnetization as a result of torsional stress and longitudinal magnetism acting jointly.
